name: Ollie
description: The foundation of street skating. Pop the tail while sliding your front foot up to level out the board in the air.
tips: Start stationary before trying while rolling
Slide your front foot — don't just jump
Timing the pop and slide is everything

name: Kickflip
description: An ollie with a flick off the heelside edge of the nose, causing the board to flip 360° along its length.
tips: Front foot angled slightly off the edge
Flick is subtle — more ankle than leg
Catch it with your back foot first

name: Heelflip
description: Like a kickflip but flicked with the heel off the toeside edge, rotating the board the opposite direction.
tips: Toes hang off the toeside edge
Push out with your heel
Keep shoulders square over the board

name: Pop Shove-It
description: The board rotates 180° beneath you (backside) while you stay facing the same direction.
tips: Scoop the tail backward with your back foot
Keep your weight centered
Don't jump too high — let the board spin under you

name: Frontside Pop Shove-It
description: The board rotates 180° frontside beneath you. Opposite rotation of a regular (backside) pop shove-it.
tips: Push the tail forward instead of scooping back
Front foot guides the catch
Easier if you lean slightly forward

name: 360 Flip (Tre Flip)
description: A combination of a kickflip and a 360 pop shove-it. The board flips and rotates 360° simultaneously. One of the most iconic tricks in skateboarding.
tips: Back foot does most of the work — big scoop
Front foot flicks lightly
Let it come to you; don't chase it

name: Varial Kickflip
description: A kickflip combined with a backside pop shove-it. The board flips and rotates 180° simultaneously.
tips: Less scoop than a tre flip
Keep your flick consistent
Catch with back foot

name: Varial Heelflip
description: A heelflip combined with a frontside pop shove-it.
tips: Front foot flicks heel while back foot scoops frontside
Keep centered
Timing is everything

name: Hardflip
description: A kickflip combined with a frontside pop shove-it. The board flips vertically between your legs.
tips: The board goes between your legs — commit
Strong frontside scoop
Catch it early

name: Inward Heelflip
description: A heelflip combined with a backside pop shove-it. The board flips inward between your legs.
tips: Scoop backside while flicking heel
Board comes inward — watch your shins
Commit fully

name: Backside 180
description: An ollie with a 180° backside rotation of both you and the board.
tips: Wind up your shoulders before popping
Head turns first, body follows
Land rolling switch

name: Frontside 180
description: An ollie with a 180° frontside rotation. You and the board turn frontside together.
tips: Look over your front shoulder
Lead with your upper body
Spot your landing

name: Backside Boardslide
description: Ollie onto a rail or ledge and slide with the middle of the board perpendicular to the obstacle.
tips: Turn 90° and center your weight over the rail
Keep your knees bent
Turn out at the end — don't hang up

name: 50-50 Grind
description: Ollie onto a rail or ledge and grind with both trucks locked on.
tips: Approach parallel to the obstacle
Lock both trucks on simultaneously
Lean slightly toward the obstacle

name: 5-0 Grind
description: A grind on only the back truck, like a manual on a rail or ledge.
tips: Keep your weight over the back truck
Don't lean too far back or you'll slip out
Pop off at the end

name: Nosegrind
description: A grind on only the front truck. Requires precise weight distribution and commitment.
tips: Lean forward and lock the front truck
Keep the tail up
Nollie out or turn 90° to dismount

name: Smith Grind
description: Back truck grinds with the board angled down below the obstacle. Front truck hangs below the ledge/rail.
tips: Approach at a slight angle
Dip the nose below the ledge
Pop out cleanly to avoid hang-ups

name: Feeble Grind
description: Back truck grinds with the board going over the obstacle. The opposite of a smith grind.
tips: Ollie high enough to clear the rail with your front truck
Lock the back truck and lean in
Commit — half-attempts are dangerous

name: Crooked Grind
description: A nosegrind with the board angled, nose pinching the edge of the ledge.
tips: Angle your approach slightly
Lock the nose at an angle
Wax helps

name: Kickflip Backside Tailslide
description: Kickflip into a backside tailslide on a ledge. A high-level combination trick requiring precision and commitment.
tips: Master both tricks independently first
Flip early and catch before locking in
Full commitment required

name: Drop In
description: Standing at the top of a ramp or bowl, place your tail on the coping and lean forward to roll in.
tips: Commit — leaning back = slamming
Stomp your front foot and lean in
Start on small ramps

name: Rock to Fakie
description: Roll up a ramp, let your front trucks go over the coping, then rock back and roll down fakie.
tips: Don't go too far over — just past the coping
Lift the front slightly to clear the coping on the way back
Keep weight centered

name: Axle Stall
description: Ride up and stall with both trucks on the coping, then drop back in.
tips: Turn 90° at the top
Set both trucks on the coping
Lean in to drop back

name: Blunt to Fakie
description: Ride up, pop the tail over the coping so the board is vertical on the deck, then pop back in fakie.
tips: Pop hard to get the tail over
Balance point is critical
Snap back in quickly

name: Manual
description: Rolling on only the back two wheels — a wheelie on a skateboard.
tips: Find the balance point
Use your arms for micro-adjustments
Look ahead, not at your feet

name: Nose Manual
description: Rolling on only the front two wheels. Harder than a regular manual due to weight distribution.
tips: Lean forward but don't nosedive
Shift weight over the front bolts
Arms out for balance

name: Impossible
description: The board wraps vertically around your back foot in a full 360° rotation.
tips: Scoop straight down and wrap it around your foot
Keep it vertical — a flat impossible isn't an impossible
Back foot does all the work

name: Laser Flip
description: A heelflip combined with a 360 frontside pop shove-it. The inverse of a tre flip.
tips: Strong frontside scoop with the back foot
Heel flick needs perfect timing
One of the hardest flat tricks — patience

name: Nollie
description: An ollie popped from the nose instead of the tail. Front foot pops, back foot slides.
tips: Mirror your ollie technique
Pop the nose with your front foot
Slide your back foot toward the tail

name: Switch Ollie
description: An ollie performed in switch stance (riding opposite your natural stance).
tips: Practice riding switch first
Everything feels backwards — be patient
Your 'weak' foot needs to learn to pop

name: Switch Kickflip
description: A kickflip performed in switch stance. Requires solid switch pushing and flick control.

name: Switch Heelflip
description: A heelflip in switch stance. The heel flick feels unnatural at first but becomes second nature.

name: Nollie Kickflip
description: Pop from the nose and flick a kickflip. Weight distribution over the front truck is key.

name: Nollie Heelflip
description: A heelflip initiated from a nollie pop. The flick goes forward off the nose-side edge.

name: Fakie Kickflip
description: A kickflip while riding fakie. Often considered easier than nollie or switch variants.

name: Fakie Heelflip
description: A heelflip while rolling fakie. The pop and flick feel similar to regular but reversed.

name: Switch Pop Shove-It
description: A backside pop shove-it performed in switch stance.

name: Nollie Pop Shove-It
description: Popping from the nose and scooping a shove-it. A great intro to nollie tricks.

name: Fakie Pop Shove-It
description: A pop shove-it while riding fakie. One of the easier fakie tricks to learn.

name: Switch 360 Flip
description: The tre flip in switch. A gold-standard trick that separates pros from amateurs.

name: Nollie 360 Flip
description: A tre flip from nollie. The scoop comes from the nose with a simultaneous kickflip.

name: Fakie 360 Flip
description: Tre flip while rolling fakie. Many skaters find this the most natural tre flip variant.

name: Switch Frontside 180
description: A frontside 180 in switch. Requires committing to the blind rotation.

name: Switch Backside 180
description: A backside 180 in switch stance. Wind up your shoulders and commit.

name: Nollie Backside 180
description: Pop from the nose and rotate backside 180. A staple nollie trick.

name: Nollie Frontside 180
description: A frontside 180 from a nollie pop. Great for lines and combos.

name: Fakie Backside 180
description: A half-cab — one of the most fundamental fakie tricks. Named after Steve Caballero.

name: Fakie Frontside 180
description: Rolling fakie and rotating frontside 180. A must-learn for any transition skater.

name: Backside Tailslide
description: Ollie and lock your tail onto the ledge while sliding backside. Keep weight centered.

name: Frontside Tailslide
description: Approach frontside and slide on your tail. The commitment to lean back is the hardest part.

name: Backside Noseslide
description: Lock your nose onto the ledge backside. A stylish trick that looks effortless when done right.

name: Frontside Noseslide
description: Approach frontside and slide on the nose. One of the first slide tricks many skaters learn.

name: Backside Lipslide
description: Ollie over the ledge backside and slide on the middle of the board. Requires full commitment.

name: Frontside Lipslide
description: The frontside version of a lipslide — ollie over and slide. A tech ledge staple.

name: Hurricane Grind
description: Frontside 180 into a backside feeble grind position. A trick that commands respect.

name: Willy Grind
description: Nose version of a 5-0 — grinding on just the front truck. Requires precise balance.

name: Overcrook
description: An exaggerated crooked grind where the nose extends well past the ledge. Highly stylish.

name: Salad Grind
description: A varial 5-0 — the back truck grinds while the board is angled. Named after salad days.

name: Suski Grind
description: A noseblunt slide on a ledge. The nose hooks over while you slide. Named after Aaron Suski.

name: Bluntslide
description: Ollie 180 and slide on the tail with the board perpendicular. A commitment-heavy trick.

name: Nosebluntslide
description: The nose version of a bluntslide. Ollie, rotate, and lock the nose past the ledge.

name: Backside Air
description: Grab your board and launch out of the ramp backside. The quintessential vert trick.

name: Frontside Air
description: An aerial launched frontside out of the coping. Christian Hosoi made this iconic.

name: McTwist
description: A 540° backside aerial with a mute grab. Invented by Mike McGill in 1984.

name: Madonna
description: A one-footed lien air where the front foot is kicked out. Named after the pop star.

name: Stalefish
description: A backside air with a grab between the heels on the backside rail behind the back leg.

name: Melon Grab
description: Backside grab between the heels on the frontside of the board. A classic transition grab.

name: Indy Grab
description: Grabbing the toeside rail between your feet with the back hand during a frontside air.

name: Method Air
description: A backside air with a melon grab while tweaking the board behind you. Peak style.

name: Judo Air
description: A frontside air where the front foot kicks off and extends forward. Martial arts on a ramp.

name: Backside Disaster
description: Approach backside, air above the coping, 180, and re-enter the ramp tail-first on the coping.

name: Frontside Disaster
description: Frontside version — air, 180, and come back in. A staple mini-ramp trick.

name: Boneless
description: Plant your front foot on the ground, grab the board, and jump back on. Old-school magic.

name: Andrecht (Handplant)
description: A backside handplant invert on the coping. One hand on coping, one grabbing the board.

name: Eggplant
description: A frontside handplant invert. Plant your hand on the coping and invert with a grab.

name: Backside 360
description: A full 360° rotation backside while airborne. Wind up hard and commit.

name: Frontside 360
description: Full 360 rotation frontside. Harder than backside for most skaters.

name: Kickflip Frontside 180
description: Combine a kickflip with a frontside 180 rotation. Timing the catch mid-rotation is key.

name: Kickflip Backside 180
description: A kickflip with a backside 180. Popular in lines and as a ledge trick.

name: Double Kickflip
description: A kickflip that rotates twice. Requires a harder flick and higher pop.

name: Triple Kickflip
description: Three full rotations on a kickflip. Extremely difficult and requires perfect technique.

name: Double Heelflip
description: A heelflip with two rotations. Scoop hard with the heel.

name: Pressure Flip
description: A no-pop flip trick using foot pressure to spin the board. The board flips underfoot without an ollie.

name: Hospital Flip
description: A half-kickflip caught upside down, then flipped back with the back foot. A true tech trick.

name: Dolphin Flip
description: A forward-flipping varial flip — the board does a forward flip with a shove-it. Rare and stylish.

name: Gazelle Flip
description: A 360 body rotation combined with a 360 flip. One of the hardest flatground tricks.

name: Alpha Flip
description: A heelflip that flips vertically forward between your legs. Mind-bending when done right.

name: Casper Flip
description: Half-kickflip the board, catch it upside down on your back foot, then flip it back.

name: Bigspin
description: A 360 shove-it combined with a 180 body rotation. Smooth and flowy when done right.

name: Frontside Bigspin
description: A frontside 360 shove-it with a frontside 180 body rotation.

name: Biggerflip
description: A bigspin combined with a kickflip — 360 shove-it + kickflip + 180 body rotation.

name: Ghetto Bird
description: A hardflip late backside 180. Invented by Kareem Campbell.

name: Primo Slide
description: Standing on the board while it's on its side (wheels facing out) and sliding. A freestyle classic.

name: Casper Stall
description: Flip the board half over and balance on it upside-down with one foot under the deck.

name: Fingerflip
description: Use your hand to flip the board while jumping. An old-school trick that's making a comeback.

name: No Comply
description: Step off with your front foot and pop the board with your back foot to get airborne. Street classic.

name: Strawberry Milkshake
description: A no-comply impossible. Step off, scoop the board around your back foot, and land.

name: Caveman
description: Hold the board, jump, and land on it mid-air. The oldest trick in the book.

name: Beanplant
description: A boneless with a grab — plant your front foot, grab indy, and boost off the coping.

name: Pogo
description: Balance on the tail with the board vertical and hop around. Pure freestyle wizardry.

name: Handstand Flip
description: Perform a handstand on the board and flip it with your hands. The ultimate freestyle flex.

name: Railstand (Primo)
description: Stand on the side of the board with it balanced on its edge. The foundation for primo tricks.

name: Coleman Slide
description: A hands-down heelside slide. The fundamental stopping/speed control technique for downhill.

name: Toeside Slide
description: Sliding with your toes facing downhill. Harder than heelside but essential for downhill.

name: Cross Step
description: Walking up and down the board while rolling. The foundation of longboard dancing.

name: Peter Pan
description: A continuous cross-step that flows front-to-back repeatedly. Graceful longboard dancing move.

name: Ghostride Kickflip
description: Step off the board and flip it with your foot while it rolls, then hop back on.

name: Tiger Claw
description: Grab the board with your hand, jump, flip it 360° in the air, and land back on it.

name: Stand-Up Slide
description: A slide performed without putting hands down. Requires excellent balance and commitment.

name: Pivot
description: Shifting your weight to spin the board 180° on the back truck. Basic carving maneuver.
